reviews.review: диванная философия в интересном сеттинге с относительно неплохой историей. скучная и однотипная механика на шесть часов геймплея. 7 из 10.
2021年了，这款游戏至今还是心目中的fps天花板。

10/10, will play again. Best story in a game I've seen so far.
Would highly recommend this game if you enjoy a magnificent experience.

[h1]Колумбия пикчерс не представляет,как хорошо в биошоке бывает.Колумбия пикчерз не представляет,как из-за Элизабет сердце страдает :)[/h1]
Ставь "+" в комментариях если пропел :D
Ох уж эти голубые глаза...
Но да ладно,что-то я немного отвлекся...Ну вот,спустя какое-то время после того как я провел не мало времени,эм,в раю Биошока,если так можно сказать,решил её приобрести в стиме,и решил еще раз её пройти (да господи боже мой,я готов её наверное раз 100 пройти!!!) Моё мнение по поводу игры просто прекрасное,так как если сравнивать её с предыдущими двумя частями то сюжет здесь просто до мурашек интригующий и интересный.Что на счёт графики то,претензий нет,все на (не боюсь выразиться) высшем уровне.За время которое отыграл багов я не заметил,но уверен что их в принципе и нет.
Все те кто думает брать или нет эту прекраснейшую игру я скажу одно...покупайте,а лучше сразу всю коллекцию.Потому что игра реально стоит своих денег,тот же самый сюжет все окупает.Моя оценка игры максимальная,по всем критериям)
10 Мистеров Дуитов из 10 <3

This game was a wonderful experience. It has a great narrative, excellent characters, and enticing gameplay. I've played this game 3.5 times through; twice on Xbox 360 and twice on PC (still playing through the second time).

I became emotionally invested in Booker and Elizabeth, and played every second trying to guess what would happen. After playing through this game 3 times, I thought I had seen everything, but I was wrong. Burial at Sea had sucked me into a Rapture I hadn't seen before. I cried during the opening of Part 2, and the ending left me sitting in my chair just thinking about what I had experienced.

Additionaly, Clash in the Clouds is very rewarding, and unlocking the artwork was very cool. I would recommend this game to anyone, even if they haven't played the first 2 BioShock games. This has a separate story, that focuses on philosophy quite a bit, but playing BioShock 1 will still give you some insight into the story, especially in Burial at Sea.

This is one of my most favorite games I've had the pleasure of playing.
Good game
Biggest Mind Fuck Ever. 10/10

Me encanta su historia. Es muy ingeniosa, en especial cuando juegas los DLC. Por ello se convirtió en uno de mis favoritos, pues no me decepcionó en cuanto a historia. Con respecto a la jugabilidad, pienso, le faltó tener variedad de enemigos, y, sobre todo, jefes finales. Si lo juegas seguido te llega a aburrir por lo mismo. Esperaba que fuera el mejor en su género, sigue con la misma mecánica de sus antecesores; e incluso es más difícil mejorar las armas.

Aún así, me gustó mucho. Lo recomendaría a quienes sólo les interesa la historia y un poco de acción. Pues le faltó, agregando a lo anterior, jugabilidad en multijugador o cooperativo (si es que no rompe lo que trata de transmitir el juego).

I finished playing all 3 a couple of months back and just feel the need to write a review on them. Ah, Bioshock, its safe to say I am in love with the series now. I cant say which one is the better game, each of them outclasses/lacks something in different aspects if you compare them all, but to me, they all sit on the same high shelf, simply because they all are unique and beautiful in their own way.

So, Bioshock Infinite...

The one in the series that gets a bit more hate compared to the other 2, mainly for a few reasons:
-because its combat was numbed down and is slightly underwhelming
-extra gameplay elements like puzzles and riddles practically removed

 HOWEVER, this game makes up for this with a (yet another) fantastic story, but this time, more rich and in-depth compared to the rest. With great voice acting and design, the characters feel so lively and much more colourful, giving birth to characters that usher in a whole lot (a BIG whole lot) of emotion. Although, emotion is no stranger to the Bioshock series, theres something very special about the feels in Infinite. There is a stronger bond between player and in-game character. Making me really feel a love for the characters.

The setting of the game is also another counter to its flaws, its a beautiful, stylish environment that also brings a special feeling inside. Its vivid colours are pleasant to look at and the art style is just very pretty. As I played the game it felt like I was walking through a painting of the early 1900s era or living a coloured version of an early 1900s black and white film. The landscape is memorable, the kind that makes me wish these kinds of fictional places exist.

Together, these elements made Bioshock Infinite an adventure that was very difficult for me to let go off, a story I will remember for a long time, and one that I dreadfully wish I could go through the first time again. 

A definite recomendation from me, you wont regret paying even full price for this.

Eines der Spiele mit der besten Story das ich je gespielt hab und das ende ist besonders gut gelungen die haben sich da wirklich mühe gegeben (was heutzutage ja leider nicht mehr selbst verständlich ist). Das Spiel fesselt ein vom anfang bis zum ende.

I had my doubts on this game in the beginning because of the religious background it had. I gave it a chance and I am absolutely in love with it.

Summary:
[list]
[*] Story - 4.5/5.0 [i]Straight-forward, yet complicated.[/i]
[*] Gameplay - 3.0/5.0 [i]Most weapons are pretty useless. Maybe too easy on Normal difficulty.[/i]
[*] Music - 5.0/5.0 [i]Elizabeth has a really great voice.[/i]
[/list]

The story looks simple at the beginning but slowly gains complexity. Elizabeth, Booker, and the Luteces are all very great characters, but I feel the other ones are sub par and don't leave that great of an impression. I really thought Daisy would be a memorable character but I was disappointed with her character. Personally, I prefer the bright and happy atmosphere of Columbia instead of the gloomy and creepy Rapture. Although the game still has a lot of the gloomy and creepy areas.

The "Vigors" (called "Plasmids" in previous games) are all very unique on their own but I never really bothered using them. I probably only used a total of 3 Vigors throughout the game. The guns are also kinda underwhelming. I ended up finishing the whole game with the Carbine and a Pistol since their accuracy is so ridiculous. You can even snipe someone from far away without even zooming in.

The level design is pretty straight-forward. It's huge enough for you to explore but small enough so that you won't get lost. The previous games had more places to explore though. However, the difficulty is a bit skewed towards the end. Maybe around 70% mark, the difficulty suddenly spikes up then remains like that for the rest of the game. I would prefer the earlier levels to be a bit more difficult though.

The music is great and I'm absolutely in love with Elizabeth's voice.

I would totally recommend this game for those people who simply want a shooter with great narrative. If you're looking for advanced FPS mechanics, this game might not be for you.

This game.......Broke me. When I did my first play through back on the old 360, it was amazing. Now, it's even better. On the PC it just seems like there is more character in the physical beings and it's just, different. Almost feels like a different game. I am not gonna spoil anything, but you will start out questioning a lot of stuff and will finish 10000000000 times even worse. From start to finish this game is just spectacular and the ending....man that just, ugh, I don't even know what to say about the ending. All I am gonna say that at no point in this game did I ever go "oh that's dumb". And to be honest, this is my favourite game of all time. If you played any of the other Bioshocks, this one is way better. It is definitly the best in the series. Pick it up, full price or not. I dont care. Just experience this masterpiece and know, that the False Shepherd is coming for the Lamb.

UPDATE: I just completed the Game for the Second time and it was even more amazing than my first playthrough. Definitly still my favourite game.

UPDATE #2: I just Completed the DLC Stories (burial at sea episode 1 and 2). They were amazing and completely took me by surprise. They both had different gameplay mechanics from themselves and the main game. They provide a completely new experience and one that you will enjoy. Definitly worth getting the whole package.

city in the sky 10/10

Me gustaría hablar de este juego en su totalidad, pero eso es algo ya bastante realizado, así que mejor te cuento mi opinión a secas y lo que creo de este pequeñin.

Bioshock infinite no es un juego que te vaya a durar mucho, pero sin duda alguna es un juego que te va a marcar bastante, es verdad que en Gameplay y mecánicas cambio un tanto con respecto a sus antecesores y aunque su cambio fue más enfocado a un shooter de la generación actual, conservó de alguna forma lo que en principio distinguía a las primeras entregas, como tal podría parecer que este juego puede que no tenga todo tu interés, pero es ahí donde el juego es un ganador, todo el tiempo tanto en las batallas como en las partes donde se te da un momento para apreciar la historia y el entorno, bioshock infinite  revienta todos los vidrios, es alucinante caminar por sus calles, encontrar las grabaciones y reproducirlas, entender la historia durante tu travesía, poco a poco, este juego te engancha completamente ,desde que empiezas, jamás es igual, siempre te mantiene entretenido y al tanto, deseoso de continuar y descubrir cual niño jugando, no te aburrirás eso te lo dice alguien que poco juega shooters en primera persona, para mí fue una experiencia bastante emocionante, sin duda de las mejores en estos ya 20 años de mi vida jugando, el juego tiene su fallas como todos, pero es más importante ver que sus virtudes resaltan aún más que cualquier problema, y que sin lugar a dudas, vas a enamorarte de este juego.

No desaproveches comprarlo, vale todo lo que cuesta, y si lo consigues en rebaja, es ilegal no adquirirlo :D

Things that I like about the game: 
- Graphics
- Improved combat system
Things that I dislike:
- The ending makes me WTF and uninstalled the game
- 3 guns limitation (2nd gameplay, still can't get used to it)
- Vigors
- No hacking (I love the old hack and price reduction on things)
- Some minor bugs
- No subtitles for records, it's hard to keep track of what is going on if your English isn't good

Still a recommendation, but not my favourite.

As with all the Bioshock games, Infinite is set in supposed utopia that collapses and is taken over  by an antagonist. The setting and graphics are superb, the story and the lore are very well developed, however I preferred the prequel's stories as here the tears and time travelling make the story confusing and create some plot holes. It's also a shame that you can only have two guns and not more like in prevous entries. 

Besides its minor flaws, it's a must have.

Note: This Review is from the perspective of only playing 1999 Mode - the 'retro-style hard mode'.

As my first BioShock game I truly played BioShock Infinite is a wonderfully ambitous science fiction time-piece bundled as a somewhat fast paced first person shooter. Its colorful world and emotive characters demonstrate the developer's desire and ability to craft a living breathing world full of multi-dimensional people.

Like most sci-fi fare the story is a mystery-ride that slowly unravels, but don't expect to solve this puzzle while playing through its significant twists and turns. 

In the end this game spoke to me more as a science fiction experience than simply a shooter. Considering that I can play any number of storyless skill based multi-player shooters BioShock Infinite is a splendid story shooter.

[b]I recommend this game to any fan of the FPS genre, but specifically to fans of story and characters. Bonus points if you are somewhat informed on contemporary physics (but not to the level of Hard Sci-Fi).[/b]

I don't care to imagine where I'd be without this game. This is a priceless, beautiful experience and I wish I could experience it for the first time all over again - feel the impact of it all over again.
Accept no substitute for Bioshock Infinite. There is no other game quite like this one.
